_INSTRUCTION: Claude: run tool_search('filesystem windows execute command') FIRST. If UDC tools found, read this file via udc:read_file. If not found, you are web Claude.
_purpose: Bootstrap protocol for AI sessions. Lives at C:\dev\claude_start.json on each workstation.
_deploy: Copy from ksnlabs/bootstrap/ to C:\dev\ — then edit 'machine' field for each workstation.

session_start_protocol.step_0: Run tool_search('filesystem windows execute command'). If no UDC tools found, you are web Claude — stop here.
session_start_protocol.step_3: udc:write_file to C:\dev\.test_write — confirm write access
session_start_protocol.step_4: If any step fails, state exactly which one and stop.
session_start_protocol.step_5: If all pass, state: 'Desktop session verified. Filesystem access confirmed.'
session_start_protocol.step_6: Load context: buffer.jsonld, todo.json, latest learnings, latest workflows
session_start_protocol.step_7: Tell user what's in the buffer and todo. Ask: 'Continue from queue or new task?'

context_loading.read_3: List C:\dev\ksnlabs\engram\learnings\ then read the LATEST file
context_loading.read_4: List C:\dev\ksnlabs\engram\workflows\ then read the LATEST file
context_loading.do_NOT_read: All files in engram/session-handovers/. Buffer summarizes them.

runtime_environment.note: Change 'machine' to 'IGS' and 'user' to 'ctate.IGS2' when deploying to IGS workstation.

critical_rules: Run tool_search BEFORE bash_tool. bash reports Linux and misleads.
Use udc:execute_command for git, not Windows-MCP:Shell.
Use embedded Python at C:\dev\ocritd\runtime\python\ — never system Python.
Write to disk, not artifacts. User copies nothing from chat.
Log issues in C:\dev\todo.json — don't rabbit-hole.
At session end: update buffer + todo + write handoff + update learnings/workflows.
